cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 35 miles ENE of Daytona Beach, FL (95 miles SE of Jacksonville, FL)
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing NNW just offshore the northeast Florida coast, forecast to skirt the Georgia coast tonight and approach/brush the South Carolina coast Saturday before turning more northward and then northeastward offshore.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of the South Carolina coast (close coastal pass-by rather than direct Georgia landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Surf City NC to Cape Lookout NC (Hurricane Watch); north of Surf City to Duck NC including Pamlico & Albemarle Sounds (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cocoa Beach FL northward along the entire Georgia coast to Surf City NC (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeast Florida, entire Georgia coast, South Carolina coast, southern North Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts possible with sustained winds 50–70 kt (60–80 mph) as the western eyewall passes near Brunswick.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 6–9 ft above ground likely on the Georgia coast including St. Simons Sound and Brunswick River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches with isolated 15 inches; significant freshwater flooding and flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands; dangerous rip currents and large surf.
